result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin J. Conley

records.addlTxt:
Court calls @ 2:24 PM/ RM 301, 22CF182 & 21CM131. Defendant Justin J. Conley in court.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. State has requested 21CM131 track along and Def. has Atty John Zich on 21CM131. Court questions Def. regarding counsel. Def. responds and has spoken to Atty. Zich regarding new case. Court advises Def. of right to waive time limits on P.H. and questions if Def. would like to have a P.H. within time limits. Def. would like to wait for counsel. Court accepts waiver of time limits and finds good cause. Def. questions if next court date is mandatory appearance. Court confirms. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No use or possession of dangerous weapons.

1:28 PM Room 203 Defendant Justin J. Conley appeared by video. Attorney Kelly L Hays appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. All parties via Zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. ADA makes cash bail bond recommendation of $750 with conditions of not use or possession of dangerous weapons. Defendant makes response and requests signature bond. The Court makes findings and orders a cash bail bond of $750 with conditions of no use or possession of dangerous weapons. Adjourned Initial Appearance is scheduled on October 10, 2022 at 1:30 PM. Court recess at 1:36 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
